summary: This module provides a platform-independent API for working with file paths.
description:
Module Overview

This module provides a platform-independent API for working with file paths.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Functions.

  • For an example on the usage of the operations, see the File Path Example.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path free from potential malicious codes

returnParameters.description: The absolute path reference or else a filepath:Error if the path cannot be derived

functions.name: absolute
functions.description:
Retrieves the absolute path from the provided location.

  string|filepath:Error absolutePath = filepath:absolute(<@untainted> "test.txt");

parameters.name: parts
parameters.description: String values of the file path parts

returnParameters.description: String value of the file path or else a filepath:Error if the parts are invalid

functions.name: build
functions.description:
Joins any number of path elements into a single path.

  string|filepath:Error path = filepath:build("/", "foo", "bar");

returnParameters.description: The extension of the file, an empty string if there is no extension, or else a filepath:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: extension
functions.description:
Retrieves the extension of the file path. The extension is the suffix beginning at the final dot in the final element of the path. It is empty if there is no dot.

  string|filepath:Error extension = filepath:extension("path.bal");

returnParameters.description: The name of the file or else a filepath:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: filename
functions.description:
Retrieves the base name of the file from the provided location, which is the last element of the path. Trailing path separators are removed before extracting the last element.

  string|filepath:Error name = filepath:filename("/A/B/C.txt");

returnParameters.description: String value of the path list separator

functions.name: getPathListSeparator
functions.description:
Returns the path variable's separating character for paths of the underlying operating system.

  string pathListSeparator = filepath:getPathListSeparator();

functions.name: getPathSeparator
functions.description:
Returns the path separator of the underlying operating system.

  string pathSeparator = filepath:getPathSeparator();

returnParameters.description: true if path is absolute, false otherwise, or else an filepath:Error occurred if the path is invalid

functions.name: isAbsolute
functions.description:
Reports whether the path is absolute. A path is absolute if it is independent of the current directory. On Unix, a path is absolute if it starts with the root. On Windows, a path is absolute if it has a prefix and starts with the root: c:\windows.

  boolean|filepath:Error isAbsolute = filepath:isAbsolute("/A/B/C");

returnParameters.description: True if the path is a Windows reserved name or else false otherwise

functions.name: isReservedName
functions.description:
Reports whether the filename is reserved. Reserved words only exist in Windows.

  boolean|filepath:Error path = filepath:isReservedName("abc.txt");

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: String value of the target file path

returnParameters.description: true if the filename of the path matches with the pattern, false otherwise, or else an filepath:Error if the path or pattern is invalid

functions.name: matches
functions.description:
Reports whether the complete filename (not just a substring of it) matches the provided Glob pattern. An error is returned if the pattern is malformed.

  boolean|filepath:Error matches = filepath:matches("a/b/c.java", "glob:*.{java,class}");

returnParameters.description: Normalized file path or else a filepath:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: normalize
functions.description:
Returns the shortest path name equivalent to the given path. Replace the multiple separator elements with a single one. Eliminate each "." path name element (the current directory). Eliminate each inner ".." path name element (the parent directory).

  string|filepath:Error normalizedPath = filepath:normalize("foo/../bar");

returnParameters.description: Path of the parent directory or else a filepath:Error if an error occurred while getting the parent directory

functions.name: parent
functions.description:
Returns the enclosing parent directory. If the path is empty, parent returns ".". The returned path does not end in a separator unless it is the root directory.

  string|filepath:Error parentPath = filepath:parent("/A/B/C.txt");

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: String value of the base file path

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: String value of the target file path

returnParameters.description: The extension of the file, empty string otherwise, or else an filepath:Error occurred if at least one path is invalid

functions.name: relative
functions.description:
Returns a relative path, which is logically equivalent to the target path when joined to the base path with an intervening separator. An error is returned if the target path cannot be made relative to the base path.

  string|filepath:Error relativePath = filepath:relative("a/b/c", "a/c/d");

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Security-validated string value of the file path

returnParameters.description: Resolved file path or else a filepath:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: resolve
functions.description:
Returns the filepath after the evaluation of any symbolic links. If the path is relative, the result will be relative to the current directory unless one of the components is an absolute symbolic link. Resolves normalising the calls on the result.

  string|filepath:Error resolvedPath = filepath:resolve("a/b/c");

returnParameters.description: String array of the part components or else a filepath:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: split
functions.description:
Splits a list of paths joined by the OS-specific path separator.

  string[]|filepath:Error parts = filepath:split("/A/B/C");

errors.name: FileNotFoundError
errors.description: Represents error occur when the file/directory does not exist at the given filepath.

errors.name: IOError
errors.description: Represents IO error occur when trying to access the file at the given filepath.

errors.name: InvalidPathError
errors.description: Represents error occur when the given file path is invalid.

errors.name: InvalidPatternError
errors.description: Represent error occur when the given pattern is not a valid filepath pattern.

errors.name: NotLinkError
errors.description: Represents error occur when the file at the given filepath is not a symbolic link.

errors.name: RelativePathError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when the given target filepath cannot be derived relative to the base filepath.

errors.name: SecurityError
errors.description: Represents security error occur when trying to access the file at the given filepath.

errors.name: UNCPathError
errors.description: Represents error occur in the UNC path.
